caption:
In this photograph, a woman stands in shallow, murky waters. She appears to be in a wooded wetland or swampy area. She has long, blonde hair tied in a braid that falls down her back. She's dressed in a grey T-shirt and dark shorts, wading through the water. Her attire and the tools she holds suggest she is conducting some type of aquatic research or exploration.

The woman is holding a large white net, possibly for catching aquatic creatures for study. Beside her is a fallen, partially submerged tree trunk, around which some branches and debris are entangled. A white bucket is also visible on the tree trunk, likely used as a container to hold specimens or tools.

The background is lush with dense, green trees under a slightly overcast sky, providing a serene, natural backdrop, reflecting a tranquil yet wild environment. The image conveys a sense of solitude and the calm focus of field work in natural science or ecology.
title: EPA Gulf Breeze Laboratory: Field trip to Tom King Bayou Dana Beth Tyler, fishery biologist, is dip netting for non-contaminated female shrimp. These will be used for comparison with contaminated female shrimp in study of transmission of PCB to the young.
